news_items.content: Here's a rewritten version of the news article:
Tamil Nadu custodial death sparks concerns about state accountability. The Madras High Court has questioned whether the state can exercise such power.
The Tamil Nadu police announced two arrests for possessing methamphetamine, part of efforts to combat narcotics trafficking.
A standoff at a cinema in Chennai resulted in the drowning of three students and one woman's attempted suicide over dowry harassment allegations.
Another incident involving an 8-year-old student on the Indian Institute of Technology Madras campus drew attention for allegedly harassing her.
The Governor has ordered an inquiry into irregularities in the Jharkhand civil services examination.
A photo campaign by Modi-Nitish posters shows solidarity between Bihar and India's capital city, Ahmedabad.
Quad leaders have called for action against plotters and funders of a recent attack on Pahalgam.
Sanjeev Arora resigned from the Rajya Sabha after being elected to his new constituency in Ludhiana West.
The High Court has warned a parliamentarian about an official's attempt to bribe him for a power connection in Chennai.
A man was arrested for attempting to bribe an official and receive Rs 15,000 for a new power connection in the city.
Kuldeep Yadav's treatment of politicians was questioned by others, who felt his exclusion from a group photo with a prominent politician sparked outrage.
In response, the politician expressed regret over the incident, stating he did not intend to exclude anyone unfairly.
